user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of send_bad_request:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
send_bad_request (struct MHD_Connection *con)
{
  struct MHD_Response *res;
  enum MHD_Result ret;

  res =
    MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (strlen (BAD_REQUEST_PAGE),
                                            (const void *) BAD_REQUEST_PAGE);
  ret = MHD_queue_response (con, MHD_HTTP_BAD_REQUEST, res);
  MHD_destroy_response (res);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function send_bad_request:
#define BAD_REQUEST_PAGE "<html>\n""<head>\n""<title>WebSocket chat</title>\n""</head>\n""<body>\n""Bad Request\n""</body>\n""</html>\n"
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No suspicious fragments found. The only use of a <string.h> function is strlen(BAD_REQUEST_PAGE). BAD_REQUEST_PAGE is defined as adjacent string literals, which the compiler concatenates into a single null-terminated string literal object; therefore strlen will scan within the bounds of that object and cannot access beyond it. There are no other calls to the Standard Library string.h functions listed in Rule 21.17 (memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, strspn) that could cause out-of-bounds accesses. The cast to (const void *) and the call to MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static are not string.h operations and are outside the scope of Rule 21.17. Consequently, there are no code fragments in the provided code that need further investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17.
